original: 'jigs pa'i nga ro sgra skad sna tshogs pa sgrog pa dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / kha rlangs kyis thams cad skye bung zhes byed pa dang / rab tu 'jigs pa'i rlung nag dang / grang ba dang / tsha ba'i dbugs kyis phyogs bcu kun tu khams 'khrug par byed pa /
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i nga ro sgra skad sna tshogs pa sgrog pa dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / kha rlangs kyis thams cad skye bung zhes byed pa dang / rab tu 'jigs pa'i rlung nag dang / grang ba dang / tsha ba'i dbugs kyis phyogs bcu kun tu khams 'khrug par byed pa /
translated: They caused the ten directions to be disturbed by the extremely terrifying black wind and the hot and cold breath.

original: nad bzhi brgya rtsa bzhis 'debs @201b par byed pa /
analyzed: nad bzhi brgya rtsa bzhis 'debs @201b par byed pa /

original: myos shing nyams par byed pa'i mthus klu'i rigs dang / lha ma yin gyi ris dang / lha'i ris dang / tshangs pa'i ris dang / 'od gsal dang / dge rgyas dang / 'bras bu che ba man chad dbang du bsdus so //
analyzed: myos shing nyams par byed pa'i mthus klu'i rigs dang / lha ma yin gyi ris dang / lha'i ris dang / tshangs pa'i ris dang / 'od gsal dang / dge rgyas dang / 'bras bu che ba man chad dbang du bsdus so //
translated: By the power of his intoxication and corruption, he brought under his control the nāga class, the asura class, the deva class, the Brahmā class, the Ābhāsvara, the Śubhakṛtsna, and the Bṛhatphala.

original: de sngon brten pa'i stobs kyis thams cad mkhyen pas gzigs nas thugs rjes 'dul bar gyur to //
analyzed: de sngon brten pa'i stobs kyis thams cad mkhyen pas gzigs nas thugs rjes 'dul bar gyur to //
translated: Then, because of his previous support, the omniscient one saw him and disciplined him with compassion.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdo rje bkod pa sgyu 'phrul dra bas 'jig rten drug gis phyogs bcu'i srid pa gsum gyi bdag po 'dul ba'i nga rgyal chen po gzi brjid chen po bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang /

translated: Then, in order to demonstrate the great pride and great splendor of the tathāgatas’ subjugation of the lords of the three existences in the six worlds of the ten directions through the net of illusions of the array of the vajra of the tathāgatas, all the tathāgatas entered the saṃādhi called Vajra Array of the Net of Illusions of All Tathāgatas.

original: gsung dang / thugs rdo rje'i bdag po bcom ldan 'das dgyes pa chen po khro bo'i rgyal po'i dkyil 'khor gyi sprin 'byung ba chen po rnam par spros pa'i sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i rgyal po ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: gsung dang / thugs rdo rje'i bdag po bcom ldan 'das dgyes pa chen po khro bo'i rgyal po'i dkyil 'khor gyi sprin 'byung ba chen po rnam par spros pa'i sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i rgyal po ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: The Bhagavān, the lord of the vajra of body, speech, and mind, the great joyful wrathful king, entered into equipoise in the samādhi of the king of magical nets that emanates the great cloud of the maṇḍala.

analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi dbyings las khro mo dbang phyug ma chen mo mngon du phyung ste /

original: hi hi dgyes pa'i gzi mdangs kyis //
analyzed: hi hi dgyes pa'i gzi mdangs kyis //
translated: With the splendor of hūṃ hūṃ joy,

original: padma rgyas par mdzad nas ni //
analyzed: padma rgyas par mdzad nas ni //

original: 'jig rten @202a *//
analyzed: 'jig rten @202a *//

analyzed: drug gi phyogs bcu mtha' yas khyab par gyur to //

analyzed: khro bo'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshogs stong gsum gyi 'jig rten tsam //
translated: The assembly of the wrathful maṇḍala was as vast as the trichiliocosm.

analyzed: phyogs bcu'i rdul phra mo snyed thon bar gyur pas 'jig rten drug gi phyogs bcu thams cad g-yos /

analyzed: rab tu g-yos so // 'ur 'ur / rab tu 'ur 'ur /

analyzed: kun tu rab tu 'ur 'ur ro; ;chem chem / rab tu chem chem / kun tu rab tu chem chem mo //

analyzed: shig shig / rab tu shig shig /
translated: They quaked violently.

analyzed: kun tu rab tu shig shig go / gtor gtor / rab tu gtor gtor /

translated: The great lords, the greatly powerful, the greatly majestic Maheśvara and so forth, who dwell in the ten directions of the six worlds, were completely knocked out.

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das dgyes pa chen po shin tu rngam pas kyi bung zhes byed pa 'bar ba chen po'i khrag 'thung /
translated: Then the blessed one, the greatly joyful one, the very wrathful one, the one called “the humming of bees,” the great blazing blood drinker,

analyzed: sku smug nag cir yang 'gyur pa /
translated: the dark blue body that turns into anything,

analyzed: dbu dang phyag dang zhabs stong khams kyi rdul snyed mtshon cha sna tshogs 'dzin pa de dbu gsum phyag drug zhabs bzhir gyur te /

analyzed: dur khrod chen por dgyes nas khrag gi rgya mtsho'i dkyil na keng rus chen po'i ri rab kyi steng /
translated: In the great charnel ground, in the middle of an ocean of blood, on a mountain of great skeletons,

analyzed: khro bo'i dkyil 'khor sprin phung gi tshogs thams cad de dag kyang la la ni /

analyzed: btsun mo khrag 'thung chen mo rnams kyang so sor sku la 'khril ba'i tshul gyis bzhugs so //

analyzed: rigs lnga'i he ru ka las gcig tu bstim ste bsdus nas /

translated: Then the great arrogant ones and so forth, with their fierce minds, displayed various great, evil, magical powers. With one voice, they spoke these evil, fierce words:🔽 Kye ma!

analyzed: kh'a hi kh'a hi kh'a hi zhes brjod pas /

analyzed: dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa gdug pa chen po'i tshogs chen po de dag gi snying dang dbang po kun phyung /

original: nang khrol kun drangs /
analyzed: nang khrol kun drangs /

analyzed: yan lag kun bcang gtubs nas khrag kun 'thungs nas rus pa kun 'chos so //

analyzed: de nas h'um h'um h'um bhyo ae aa ra li dza dza zhes brjod pas /

analyzed: phyogs bcu 'jig rten gyi khams nam mkha' dang bcas par yungs 'bru gcig tsam gyi nang du chud par bsdus so //

analyzed: de nas 'byung po ma lus pa'i rgyal po'i yang rgyal po //
translated: Then, the king of all spirits, the king of kings,

translated: the queen of all the queens of the great arrogant ones and so forth,🔽the great rakshasa woman, the rakshasa woman of humans, Brahma, Durga, Kamadhatvisvari, Kumari, Rakta, Amrita, Santi, and Musala,

analyzed: srin mo dang / za ba mo dang / dga' mo dang / ra ro khrag 'thung @203b myos pa dang / gcig pu spyod ma dang / yid 'phrog mo dang / grub mo dang / rlung mo dang / gsod byed ma dang / me mo dang /
translated: rakshasa, Bhaksi, Rati, Madana, Rakta-pibana, Ekacarya, Manohara, Siddhi, Maruta, Marana, and Agni.

analyzed: phag mo dang / rgan byad mo dang / sna chad mo dang / chu lha mo dang / nag mo chen mo dang / ra mgo dmar ser chen mo dang / bum sna sngo nag mo dang / gsus 'dzin ser nag chen mo la sogs pa bran dang yang bran dang / g-yog dang yang g-yog dang / 'khor zhing gi rdul rnyed bsdus so // de nas bcom ldan 'das dgyes pa chen po dpal khrag 'thung chen pos 'dul ba'i thabs kyis yang rigs lnga'i 'jigs byed chen por snang bar byas nas de dag kun dgyes par rol pa'i dkyil 'khor sprin 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs
translated: attendants, and more attendants, and the hosts of the dust of the earth were gathered.🔽Then, the bhagavān, the great glorious wrathful heruka, through the method of taming, appeared as the five great families of Bhairava.

analyzed: nas sku dang / gsung dang / thugs rdo rje las 'di dag phyung ngo //

translated: Saying Oṃ āṃ hūṃ vajra praveśa ā la la hoḥ, the queens of the elements are stirred by the mind of great passion, and the maṇḍala of the lotus is contracted and expanded.

translated: For example, just as iron is attracted to a magnet, the great rākṣasī of humans, the red one, the joyful one, the killer,🔽the great black one, the great red-orange one, the great blue-black one, and the great yellow-black one embrace the glorious great Bhagavān, the great blood drinker, the vajra body, with great passion.

translated: The great Bhagavān, the glorious great blood drinker, the vajra body, is embraced by Brahmāṇī, Rudrāṇī, Raudrī, Vārāhī, and Kumārī.

original: bcom ldan 'das dpal khrag 'thung chen po rin po che'i sku la bdud rtsi mo dang / zhi ba mo dang / be con mo dang / za ba mo dang / srin mo rnams 'khril lo //

translated: The Blessed One, the great glorious wrathful Heruka of the precious body, is embraced by Amṛtā, Śānti, Khaṇḍarohā, Carcikā, and Rākṣasi.

translated: The Blessed One, the great glorious wrathful Heruka of the great lotus body, is embraced by Rudhirā, Ekavīrā, Manoharā, Siddhikari, and Vāyuvegā.

original: bcom ldan 'das dpal khrag 'thung chen po kun tu las kyi sku la me mo dang / phag mo dang / rgan byad mo dang / sna chad mo dang / chu lha mo rnams 'khril lo //
